text: hi and welcome my name is Dave pay a
senior product manager on the AWS ec2
Windows team in this video I will give
you an overview of the AWS diagnostics
for Microsoft Windows Server there are
three key takeaways from this video
first it is a standalone program to
analyze and troubleshoot AWS and windows
configuration second it can gather
Windows details from an offline instance
volume mounted on a running Windows
instance and third this program is in
public beta so features and functions
will change a common scenario is trying
to diagnose configuration issues between
the Windows Firewall and AWS security
groups in this demo my goal is to show
how AWS Diagnostics can be used to
troubleshoot a windows web server that
is failing to publish a homepage to the
internet the AWS web console is open and
you can see that a Windows Server
instance is running and has a public IP
address assigned to it when I try the
public IP address in a web browser the
website does not
respond however ever using the local
host address the web server responds
with the IAS
homepage let's start the AWS Diagnostics
tool the first time you run it you'll
see the license agreement go ahead and
read it if you agree to the terms click
I
agree the first option is to select the
type of instance to collect data from
the dropdown has current and offline
instance since this is the web server
let's pick current and Below we show a
list of 12 data collection modules by
unchecking select all I can then select
only the modules I want to collect from
like firewall memory jump Windows clock
check select all and all the modules
will be
selected we also let you pick where to
save the data collection files and
Report click browse to create or pick a
new folder and at the bottom program you
can start the data collection analysis
by clicking the begin button next we
will ask for the AWS credentials you can
choose an IM roll credential file or
enter your AWS environment variables
I'll use the IM roll the program will
start collecting windows and aw
information and a Time log of events
will be displayed after it completes
click the open report report button to
read the analysis
report the report file is broken into
sections and reaggregate key AWS and
windows details like instant ID part of
a VPC host name rooll of the server
memory dpace available page file size
Network information and more looking at
the security group rules analysis the
report shows the intersection of the
Windows Firewall and AWS security groups
the report shows only RDP or Port 3389
is enabled for both and Port 80 is not
enabled on AWS security
groups now that I know what to correct
let's switch to the AWS web console to
fix the problem yep looking at the
default Security Group HTTP or Port ad80
is not enabled for inbound let's go
ahead and add it select HTTP in the
dropdown and then click add Rule and
then apply the
changes let's check the public IP
address using the web browser and the
web server homepage works now let's go
back to AWS Diagnostics and take a look
at how offline instance works I've
already mounted an offline volume to the
server after you select the offline
instance use drop down to select the
drive letter of the mounted volume I'll
use the same folder as before and then
click
begin this time we only do the data
collection when the data collection is
complete you can still open report but
for the public beta we do not do
analysis a common use case would be to
contact AWS support to provide the one
zip file for us to help identify the
failure
if you like to start the troubleshooting
yourself you can drill into the data
collection folder to get access to the
offline registry and log files the
Registries can be imported as a hive in
redit to view because this is a public
beta we would like to hear your feedback
it's really important to us at the
bottom of the AWS Diagnostics program we
have a link to a feedback web page it's
a simple survey and we'd appreciate it
if you could tell us what you think
about this
program to sign up or learn more please
visit aws.amazon.com
/wi AWS Diagnostics thank you
